history.content:
Undergrad enrollment into grad cs courses is by permission of the instructor.  The instructor usually wants to make sure both that first there is sufficient capacity for graduate students interested in taking the course and then also that you have the academic background to do well in the specific graduate course in question. 

Because part of this is about what the graduate student demand is, we couldn't know that those courses would be available for undergrads until Fall 16 classes have already begun.  We also don't know until ~ February or March what the course offerings will be in Fall 2016.

children.subject:
Sorry this is late, but for 288 you should really talk to Klein directly. He doesn't teach the class very often and he just taught it in fall 2014.

I took it in F14 with him as a undergrad. That semester, he let everyone who could do the first project into the class  (including undergrads), however, that first project was pretty challenging. Some class that may help are (I did not take all of them): 188, 170, 176, 164, 189, 281A. 

That class was also quite a bit bigger than he was expecting, so it may affect future offerings.

history.content: I am wondering if anyone has taken these two classes and know the requirements to get in as undergrad. I might potentially stay an extra semester if I could take these two classes in fall 2016.
history.subject: CS281A/288
